attributes.action: Reverse the Decision to Scrap the Gender Recognition Act Consultation Results
attributes.additional_details: The government have decided to scrap the results of the consultation because they believe the results were "skewed by an avalanche of responses generated by trans rights groups” and is instead said to be preparing to introduce new laws to enforce single sex spaces, such as public lavatories, and to limit access to transgender care. This effectively means acting against the needs transgender individuals, who already are at a greater risk of experiencing hate crimes, discrimination and self-harm.
attributes.background: The government held a public consultation regarding the Gender Recognition Act.The results were overwhelmingly in favour of measures that would improve the lives of trans people such as self-ID. Plans were drawn up to put them into law but have now been scrapped. We ask for this to be reconsidered.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions instead:

Reform the Gender Recognition Act: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/327108

Uphold current legal protections for transgender individuals and under 18s:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318175

Do not ban gender transition treatments for under 18s:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318025

Add gender identity to the characteristics protected under the Equality Act 2010:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301138

Require schools and colleges to have gender neutral toilets:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302997

Introduce Gender and Race equity for GCSE English Literature set texts:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324934

Allow for a gender neutral option on a passport, such as an "X":
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301083
